Any latency, introduced by pre-processing, compression or encryption of the images, will have a significant effect on the information that can be extracted. This paper shows that low bit-depth images can be fused to reconstruct an image of the weapon's impact point and that noise in the low-bit images increases the information content of the reconstructed images - an example of suprathreshold stochastic resonance.

title: Notice of Retraction: Research on Institutional Innovation of Centralized Management Mode for Government Investment Projects Based on Transaction Costs Analysis
conferenceTitle: 2010 International Conference on E-Business and E-Government
abstract: This article has been retracted by the publisher.

title: An algorithm for path planning of multiple unmanned aerial vehicles based on Bezier curve
conferenceTitle: Proceedings of the 29th Chinese Control Conference
abstract: This paper presents an algorithm which based on Bezier curve for path planning of multiple unmanned aerial vehicles. Given the present state information such as the UAVs' present velocity, present position and the final state information such as the UAVs' final velocity, final position, this algorithm is able to generate feasible path for each UAV. This algorithm which based on the various characteristics of the Bezier curve works well on path planning of unmanned aerial vehicles, and can plan the state of each UAV such as position, velocity, and acceleration on each time point. The paths produced by the algorithm also meet the safety constraints about the UAVs, such as velocity constraints, acceleration constraints, and safe distance between UAVs.

title: The LQR Real-time Control for the Inverted Pendulum Based on PSO
conferenceTitle: 2010 International Conference on Electrical and Control Engineering
abstract: This paper established a mathematical model of the inverted pendulum system and put forward a design method of LQR based on PSO. A LQR is designed by this method according to the computer simulation experiments. The simulation results show that the inverted pendulum system with the LQR has good performance. Then the real-time control of the pendulum has been accomplished successfully based on the real-time control model built in Simulink. The LQR designed in the computer simulation experiments is applied to real-time controls. The real-time control experiments also validated the correctness of the theoretical analysis and the rightness of the computer simulation.

title: Research on adaptive subdivision algorithm based on the triangle mesh segmentation
conferenceTitle: The 2nd International Conference on Information Science and Engineering
abstract: One problem existing in the triangle mesh subdivision is the number of facets growing exponentially with every subdivision step, and the number of the subdivision surface facets is usually huge and the scheme is difficult to manipulate in post processing. To solve this problem, this paper puts forward an adaptive subdivision algorithm based on triangle mesh segmentation. This algorithm puts forward a new segmentation method for initialization based on meshes region growing, and divides control meshes into several areas connected. Algorithm is mainly divided into four stages, namely analyzing facets, initializing segmentation, computing segmentation center, and vertex segmentation. Experimental results show the algorithm, not only holds ideal smooth surface with fewer facets, but also overcomes the shortcoming of uniform meshes.

title: Research on LQR control optimized by elitist preserving genetic algorithm
conferenceTitle: The 2nd International Conference on Information Science and Engineering
abstract: It's critical to select weighing matrixes of Q and R when designing Linear Quadratic Regulator(LQR). This paper put forward a method of LQR control whose weighing matrixes are optimized by elitist preserving genetic algorithm, the best individual which enter directly into the next generation replaces the worst one during the copy process of genetic algorithm, the direct entering guarantees it won't be destroyed by the following processes, including crossover and mutation, so the fitness of the best individual of each generation increase or at least keeps the same as the step of evolution goes by, the weighing matrixes are optimized each generation. The last part of the thesis gives an example for simulation which testifies the validity of the algorithm.

title: Notice of Retraction: Research on the development of web directory service in China
conferenceTitle: 2010 2nd International Conference on Future Computer and Communication
abstract: Retracted.

title: PHD filter for multi-target visual tracking with trajectory recognition
conferenceTitle: 2010 13th International Conference on Information Fusion
abstract: Probability hypothesis density (PHD) filter, as a multi-target recursive Bayes filter, has generated substantial interest in the visual tracking field due to its ability to handle a time-varying number of nonlinear targets. But the target's trajectory cannot be identified within its own framework. To complement the ability of PHD, the auction algorithm is combined to calculate the object trajectories automatically. We present the motion detection, dynamic and measurement equation, as well as visual multi-target tracking algorithm based on Gaussian mixture probability hypothesis density (GM-PHD) in details. Experimental results on a large video surveillance dataset show the proposed multi-target tracking framework improves the tracker and recognizes the tracks when a variable number of targets appear, merge, split and disappear even in cluttered scenes.

title: Algorithms data processing system monitoring and estimation average-special educational institutions
conferenceTitle: 2010 4th International Conference on Application of Information and Communication Technologies
abstract: In given article briefly broughted algorithms of the system monitoring and estimation, which is used for making the reports.

title: Notice of Retraction: Low-carbon economy — The trend of world economy development
conferenceTitle: 2010 The 2nd Conference on Environmental Science and Information Application Technology
abstract: Retracted.

title: Tri-band filter design using substrate integrated waveguide resonators in LTCC.
conferenceTitle: 2010 IEEE MTT-S International Microwave Symposium
abstract: This paper exploits the modal orthogonality to present a new design technique for tri-band filters with minimum number of resonators. Taking advantage of the multiple modes inside one substrate integrated cavity, the coupling mechanisms for different pass bands can be selectively controlled by the modal field distributions. Thus, a tri-band filter of four-pole quasi-elliptic response can be realized by four resonators only. Also, the design can facilitate the feeding design to meet the required external quality factor at the three bands simultaneously. In terms of low-loss co-fired ceramic (LTCC) technology, the cavities are vertically stacked, and the filter size can be miniaturized.

title: Dynamical analysis of 750KV towers with high-low legs
conferenceTitle: 2010 International Conference on Mechanic Automation and Control Engineering
abstract: This paper use the finite element analysis software ANSYS to build two 750KV cup tangent angle-steel tower models which height difference of high-low legs are 0m, 6m. The dynamic response of the transmission towers with unequal legs under the Taft earthquake load has been studied in this thesis. It is provided that High-low legs tower's displacement, velocity and acceleration of control point are smaller than equal tower's. In addition, the magnitude of time-history curve of this two tower models' abutment 1 is bigger than abutment 2 when earthquake waves are inputted from three-direction. The study shows the unequal leg transmission towers should be priority to be used when they were built in the mountain area.

title: The conditional fault tolerance of (n,2)-star graph
conferenceTitle: The 2nd International Conference on Information Science and Engineering
abstract: Conditional connectivity and conditional faulty diameter have been proposed as two important parameters to estimate the fault tolerance of connect networks. In this paper, we consider the conditional connectivity and conditional fault diameter of (n,2)-star graph. we arrive that the conditional connectivity of (n,2)-star graph Sn,2 is n-1, and the conditional fault diameter of Sn,2 is 5.

title: Notice of Retraction: Red-Blue-Yellow Cherries is NP-Complete
conferenceTitle: 2010 Second International Conference on Computer Engineering and Applications
abstract: Retracted.

title: Research for current cloud computing and cloud security technology
conferenceTitle: The 2nd International Conference on Information Science and Engineering
abstract: This paper introduces the concept, development, key features, applications of cloud computing. The difference to grid computing is discussed. Eight kinds of typical open source cloud computing projects are described, the security reference models of cloud services are given. Cloud computing security challenges and countermeasures are discussed in this paper.

title: A new network reduction methodology for congestion study
conferenceTitle: IEEE PES General Meeting
abstract: System planning on a large-scale electric power system is computationally challenging. Network reduction into a small system can significantly reduce the computational expense. The Ward equivalent technique is widely used for the reduction; however, it may not yield the same flow pattern as the original network. In this paper, a new methodology for network reduction is proposed and the results are compared with those from other methodologies.

title: A chip-level OOK OCDMA receiver using an acoustooptic deflector
conferenceTitle: 7th International Symposium on High-capacity Optical Networks and Enabling Technologies
abstract: An on-off keying (OOK) optical code division multiple access (OCDMA) chip-level receiver that uses acoustooptic deflector (AOD) is presented. This receiver saves the hardware complexity encountered in conventional chip-level receivers, especially for large number of time chips. In OOK OCDMA, larger number of chips is required in order to improve the error performance or increase the number of users. The presented receiver may require no chip synchronization but symbol or frame synchronization is required. The proposed receiver can be used in tunable optical codes with minimum change in the hardware. However, this receiver has more multiple access interference (MAI) which can be reduced using optical pulse shaping or increasing the spatial separation between focused beams in the AOD. Commercially available AODs can decode OOK OCDMA signals with number of chips Yl as large as one thousand or more. The geometry, design, and operation of an AO OOK OCDMA receiver are introduced, error performance is discussed, and interference analysis is presented.

title: E-business Platform for Small and Medium Enterprises Based on SaaS - Analysis of Information Service Platform for Shunde Manufacture
conferenceTitle: 2010 International Conference on E-Business and E-Government
abstract: In this paper we analyzed the information need of small and medium enterprises in China, and proposed an e-business platform based on SaaS. Based on the given situation in Shunde manufacture, we suggested a information service platform. The platform consists of three modules, namely enterprise information management, supply chain management and supporting service management. Through the platform, the small and medium enterprises use management system like OA, ERP and CRM easily and quickly. Meanwhile, the management will extend from inside to outside and the whole supply chain can realize information sharing and collaborative working. When the service and supervisory organizations like government, bank, CA, logistics join in, the platform will become a dynamic e-business ecosystem, which will boost the new regional commercial civilization.

title: Design of MCS-51 Teaching Development Board
conferenceTitle: 2010 International Conference on E-Business and E-Government
abstract: A teaching development board system based on MCS-51 single chip processor is introduced in this paper. The software and hardware exploitation process is described in detail. The focus of the study is designing the peripheral hardware circuits and corresponding software program based on the internal structure of MCS-51. The system has complete functions and it mainly includes I/O subsystem, data collecting subsystem, digital temperature controller subsystem, communications and transmissions subsystem, etc. This system is not only suitable for beginners and advanced programmer, but also for college students who are studying the correlative courses of Principles and Applications of Single Chip Processor. Furthermore, it provides a good platform for the teaching of single-chip course in universities.

title: Notice of Retraction: A New Formula for Similarity Measures between Vague Sets
conferenceTitle: 2010 Second International Workshop on Education Technology and Computer Science
abstract: Retracted.

title: Multiclass microarray gene expression classification based on fusion of correlation features
conferenceTitle: 2010 13th International Conference on Information Fusion
abstract: In this paper, we propose novel algorithmic models based on fusion of independent and correlated gene features for multiclass microarray gene expression classification. It is possible for genes to get co-expressed via different pathways. Moreover, a gene may or may not be co-active for all samples. In this paper, we approach this problem with a optimal feature selection technique using analysis based on statistical techniques to model the complex interactions between genes. The two different types of correlation modelling techniques based on the cross modal factor analysis (CFA) and canonical correlation analysis (CCA) were examined. The subsequent fusion of CCA/CFA features with principal component analysis (PCA) features at feature-level, and at score-level result in significant enhancement in classification accuracy for different data sets corresponding to multiclass microarray gene expression data.

title: Spatial encoding in MIMO communication system in the presence of simulated multipath
conferenceTitle: 2010 20th International Crimean Conference "Microwave & Telecommunication Technology"
abstract: The investigation of transmission capacity of MIMO mobile communication system designed on principles of multipath effect has been carried out. Spatial encoding is realized by the beamforming method. Power distribution along transmit and receive antennas is specified by the principle of “water-filling”.

title: Notice of Retraction: Empirical Research of Two Attitudinal Variables of Ecologically Conscious Consumer Behavior
conferenceTitle: 2010 International Conference on E-Business and E-Government
abstract: This article has been retracted by the publisher.

title: A simulation study of fuzzy control system of Triadic Heating Furnace
conferenceTitle: The 2nd International Conference on Information Science and Engineering
abstract: The paper is introduced structures and characteristics of Triadic Heating Furnace, and designed a two-dimensional fuzzy controller to carry on the control to the heating furnace and draws support in the MATLAB software conducts the simulation research. The simulation result has confirmed that the paper designs the two-dimensional fuzzy controller for temperature control of the heating furnace is extremely effective.

title: Digital watermarking algorithm based on block singular value decomposition and BP network
conferenceTitle: 2010 Chinese Control and Decision Conference
abstract: Digital watermarking is deemed as a novel technique for copyright protection of digital products. A new digital image watermarking based on block singular value decomposition (SVD) and BP network because of their excellence is proposed. The singular values of each image sub-block are gained to form a vector by applying the SVD procedure. Then the singular value of embedded sub-block is amended, BP network built is applied to the embedment and extraction of watermarking. The algorithm recovers the watermark without any reference to the original image. Experimental results show that the new watermarking method performs well in both imperceptibility and robustness for image processing and attack, especially for geometric distortion.

title: Technology & upgrade options for broadband networks
conferenceTitle: 35th Australian Conference on Optical Fibre Technology
abstract: New technology and design options for broadband networks are described. A modified Arrayed Wave Guide router and long reach PON provide improved service resilience, future cost-effective capacity upgradeability and increase network coverage.

title: Notice of Retraction: The Relation among Job Satisfaction, Stress Level and Self-efficacy of Safety Staff in Coal Mine
conferenceTitle: 2010 International Conference on E-Business and E-Government
abstract: Retracted.

title: Notice of Retraction: Comparison and Analysis of Dispatching Protocols in China
conferenceTitle: 2010 Asia-Pacific Power and Energy Engineering Conference
abstract: Retracted.

title: Multi-Scale and Multi-Threshold Denoising Algorithm Based on the Best Wavelet Packet Basis
conferenceTitle: 2010 Chinese Conference on Pattern Recognition (CCPR)
abstract: A multi-scale and multi-threshold denoising method based on the best wavelet packet basis and a new threshold function are put forward, which is based on the wavelet packet transform and the traditional threshold denoising method .Some faults of orthogonal wavelet transform can be overcome via using wavelet packet transform. The simulation experiments for Droppler signals show that the new threshold function can suppress the white noise effectively, it is better than the classical hard, soft and a improved threshold function referred to [6] denoising methods in the visual effect and SNR and MSE. Thus, it has high practical value in signal denoising.

title: Synthesis principles for multimode waveguide units
conferenceTitle: 2010 20th International Crimean Conference "Microwave & Telecommunication Technology"
abstract: We propose principles which represent a systematic approach to the synthesis of multimode waveguides converting a specific input field into a different output field. Using these principles, fast and efficient methods of synthesis with specified properties can be constructed for any field analysis method. Synthesized waveguide components are presented to demonstrate their efficiency.

title: Notice of Retraction: Based on gray correlation analysis of the financial crisis on the road, Shenzhen, analysis of the impact of container transport research
conferenceTitle: 2010 International Conference on Computer and Communication Technologies in Agriculture Engineering
abstract: Retracted.

title: The application of the improved BP algorithm in the project investment prediction
conferenceTitle: The 2nd International Conference on Information Science and Engineering
abstract: The traditional BP learning algorithm converges slowly, and obviously depends on the step size. The paper has proposed a step-size rule using to improve BP algorithm. In the network training, it can search a relatively reasonable step length in each iteration, so it can reduce the impact of the choice of step length on learning speed greatly. The simulation results of project investment prediction show that the new algorithm is better than the traditional in the iteration time and times.

title: Stock Price Index Prediction Based on Mobile Data Mining
conferenceTitle: 2010 International Conference on E-Business and E-Government
abstract: Wireless networks and mobile devices, which had brought lots of convenience to our daily life and made us much easier to get information any time and any where, now had motivates the needs for efficient tools analyzing data streams. Data mining technology turned into a valid tool for us to make scientific decision. Data mining can transform vast data resource into available knowledge and information resource. A price index forecasting approach is proposed based on data mining in mobile environment, it combine principal component analysis (PCA), probabilistic neural networks (PNN) and general regression neural network (GRNN), and can predict the stock price index in small sample. It applies the marketing stock as test samples, and validates this proposed approach.

title: Design and implementation to intelligent online exam system for course Information Resource Management
conferenceTitle: The 2nd International Conference on Information Science and Engineering
abstract: Compared with the traditional exam, online examination system can greatly enhance the evaluation capacities, reduce the human input and improve the work efficiencies. So it has considerable economical efficiency and broad prospect. Examination is used in course Information Resource Management in order to solve the problems in evaluating. An intelligent online exam system is developed and the examination library of Information Resource Management is established. By using this system, teachers are able to check the student's knowledge of the Information resource management better. This is helping to improve the quality of teaching. The exam system can also be applied to examination of other subjects.

title: Keynote speeches
conferenceTitle: IECON 2010 - 36th Annual Conference on IEEE Industrial Electronics Society
abstract: Provides an abstract for each of the keynote presentations and may include a brief professional biography of each

title: Notice of Retraction: E-commerce customer credit evaluation based on AHP
conferenceTitle: 2010 IEEE International Conference on Software Engineering and Service Sciences
abstract: Retracted.

title: Nonlinear modeling of compound semiconductor HEMTs, state of the art
conferenceTitle: 2010 IEEE MTT-S International Microwave Symposium
abstract: Summary form only given. This paper will review the state-of-the-art for modeling compound semiconductor HFETs and HEMTs for microwave power applications.

title: Notice of Retraction: Solar building heating energy saving optimal analysis and empirical study
conferenceTitle: The 2nd International Conference on Information Science and Engineering
abstract: Retracted.

title: An Ant Colony Algorithm for Text Clustering
conferenceTitle: 2010 International Conference on Computing, Control and Industrial Engineering
abstract: In this article, a new PMACO algorithm is proposed for capacitated P-Median Problem (CPMP). It devised a set of performing strategies of Ant Colony Algorithm (ACO) in view of the characteristic of CPMP. These strategies include the selecting strategy of initial medians, the pheromone learning strategy of object-assignment means and pheromone-smoothness strategy. They insure the PMACO algorithm can solve the CPMP effectively, which was proved by the computational results. The comparability of Text Clustering Problem (TCP) and CPMP inspired us to employ the PMACO algorithm solving the TCP. As a result, we used the improved PMACO to solve the TCP and obtained preferable result. This exploited the new method of using the ACO to settle TCP self-adaptively.

title: A mesh simplification algorithm for keeping local features with mesh segmentation
conferenceTitle: 2010 International Conference on Mechanic Automation and Control Engineering
abstract: How to keep local features of the mesh and adaptive simplification becomes the research hotspot. This paper proposes a mesh segmentation algorithm and an adaptive mesh simplification algorithm, based on quadric error metric of Garland, that can keep the triangle grid local features effectively. The algorithm introduces vertex slope as the weighted value of the basic quadric error metric. Experimental results indicate that the algorithm, not only inherits higher speed and quality of the quadric error metric algorithm, but also overcomes the shortcoming of uniform grid.

title: Notice of Retraction: Low-carbon urbanization way forward for two-oriented society
conferenceTitle: 2010 IEEE International Conference on Advanced Management Science(ICAMS 2010)
abstract: Retracted.

title: The Method of SVC over P2P in Video Streaming System
conferenceTitle: 2010 International Conference on E-Business and E-Government
abstract: In general, the use uniform grouping of video stream in P2P streaming system. In this paper we use the non-uniform grouping of SVC bitstream in SVC over P2P streaming system. It can group layers based on environment and features of stream, and load tasks group by group; in other words, tasks are processed between parallelly and sequentially.

title: Vibration state forecast for electrical submersible pump unit based on dynamic gray model
conferenceTitle: 2010 International Conference on Mechanic Automation and Control Engineering
abstract: This paper discussed the fundamental contents and the process developed of the GM (1,1) forecast and the dynamic gray forecast model, and predicted the vibration state of electrical submersible pump through the above-mentioned two models in the electrical submersible pump unit of oilfield. Vibration state was described by the vibration acceleration signals. The result showed that the precision of tow models was greater than 98%, prediction error was less than 5%, and the two kinds of gray forecast model were successfully applied in vibration state forecast for electrical submersible pump. The effect of dynamic gray forecast model was better than the GM (1,1) forecast model because that it added the new information, increased the white grade of gray interzone, and had the tracking feature. This gray forecast model is simple, high precision and easily calculated in computer.

title: Keynote: Steps Toward Self-Aware Networks
conferenceTitle: 2010 10th IEEE International Conference on Computer and Information Technology
abstract: The design of a packet network where paths are dynamically selected based on Quality-of-Service (QoS) metrics that can be specified by the users of the network or by the network's access points will be presented. The approach uses on-line measurement associated with the traffic itself, and reinforcement learning throughout the nodes of the network, to try to satisfy the users' QoS objectives. The talk will present numerous measurement studies of this approach on a large laboratory test-bed. The talk is based on the recent paper in the Communications of the ACM (July 2009), which integrates different aspects of the research including network design, performance evaluation models and methods, and probability models of neuronal networks.

title: ICT image based reverse engineering of revolutionary assembles
conferenceTitle: 2010 International Conference on Mechanic Automation and Control Engineering
abstract: The no demounting reverse engineering of assembles was studied for engineering application. A new reverse engineering method for revolutionary assembles based on ICT image was proposed. The symmetric plane section image of assembles was gained by ICT. The edge of the image was extracted by different methods, and comparison was made for these methods. The 2D sketch was built on edge image. The pixel number corresponding to the dimension of each part was gained through combination of designing and reverse engineering. Finally, the pixel number was transformed to corresponding dimension and standardization was made. Example shows that the method can efficiently reverse engineer the assembly CAD model, which has revolutionary feature.

title: Research of campus high-speed net model
conferenceTitle: 2010 International Conference on Mechanic Automation and Control Engineering
abstract: With campus networks business growing, the networks are asked to meet real-time and half real-time business performance and the quality of services such as VOIP and IPTV. Through the measurement and analysis of campus network's primary service, association deduce the self-similarity model and queuing model, and the correlation value ρ is calculated. This paper sets up a suitable multi-port input queuing model, and calculates the network bandwidth of this model which satisfies the need of real-time and half real-time.

title: Evaluation of College Students' Quality on PCA-BP Neural Networks
conferenceTitle: 2010 International Conference on E-Business and E-Government
abstract: A BP neural network model based on principal component analysis(PCA) is proposed to evaluate the college student information quality comprehensively. The principal component analysis is adopted to process the evaluation index by dimension reduce. And then a BP neural network evaluation model of college students' information quality is established.

title: The research of division and integration of traffic control subzones based on distance+cycle rule
conferenceTitle: Proceedings of the 29th Chinese Control Conference
abstract: In order to avoid annulment of the traffic control system and enhance traffic performance of it, lately people bring forwards the topic of the division and intergration of traffic control subzones. And the paper is based on the topic. At first, the paper illustrates the meaning of division of traffic control subzones, then it categorizes all the division rules and decides to make the distance+cycle rule as the resort of division rule in the paper. The essay utilizes the cycle rule to select a certain intersection as the probing intersection of a subarea, at the same time, it establishes a probing model based on the cycle and divides the subareas with the help of the cycle principle. And at last paper simulates the division process based on 9 intersections with the VISSIM. after division of distance+cycle principle, the average queuing length of every intersection reduces 35.8% compared with isolated control strategy, the average delay of every intersection reduces 41 % compared with isolated control strategy.

title: Design and implementation based on FPGA of a group of three-dimension chaotic system
conferenceTitle: 2010 8th World Congress on Intelligent Control and Automation
abstract: In order to improve randomicity of chaos system, A novel switched chaotic model is presented based on Lorenz system by modifying the third equation's product. The system consists of three chaotic subsystems and can change its behavior random among of the two or three subsystems via selector. The switchable system makes up of four switchable chaos subsystems. Some of its basic dynamical properties are studied detailedly, such as the feature of equilibrium, the phase portraits of hyperchaotic attractor, the Lyapunov exponexnt and the fractal dimension. Furthermore, A practical circuit is designed to realize the systems obtained based FPGA by EDA technology. It shows good agree with the simulation.

title: Text Encryption Algorithm Based Cyclic Shift
conferenceTitle: 2010 International Conference on E-Business and E-Government
abstract: Based on the analyses of two kinds of physical encryption algorithm, this paper proposed a matrix scrambling algorithm which is based on two-way circular queue, three other improved algorithms were also presented. This matrix scrambling algorithm can be used for text encryption. The discussion of characteristics of these algorithms was also included in this paper, these algorithms were also evaluated by several different methods, and the evaluation results confirmed that the cyclic dual line (or dual rank) shift formula is an optimal matrix scrambling method.

title: Analysis of perspective antenna systems with controlled 3-dimensional signal space division
conferenceTitle: 2010 20th International Crimean Conference "Microwave & Telecommunication Technology"
abstract: The antenna system with controlled 3-dimentional signal space division constructions and characteristics for all radio frequency range investigation are reviewed in this work.

title: Notice of Retraction: Research about realization design and ecological concept of “to make the best use of everything” in product packaging
conferenceTitle: 2010 The 2nd Conference on Environmental Science and Information Application Technology
abstract: Retracted.

title: The relationships among service quality, customer satisfaction, and repurchase intention in SMS
conferenceTitle: 2010 International Symposium on Computer, Communication, Control and Automation (3CA)
abstract: This paper discusses the relationships among service quality, customer satisfaction and repurchases intention with the use of SMS. Data were collected using convenience sampling, a total of 329 useable responses were collected and retained for analysis. The findings confirm perceived service quality contribute to generating customer satisfaction and repurchase intention with SMS. The results also show that customer satisfaction enhances repurchase intention of customer.)

title: Design and movement simulation of the loading mechanism in high-speed tire testing machine
conferenceTitle: 2010 International Conference on Mechanic Automation and Control Engineering
abstract: One of the key components of the tire testing machine is the loading mechanism, ability to accurately simulate the gesture and loaded situation of tire work is the main point of the design. One model for loading mechanism is presented in this paper, better implementation of the simulation of the attitude of the tires movement of leaning and deviation. Define the drive mode and drive functions of the loading mechanism and demonstrated that the designed loading mechanism and the actual suspension mechanism have excellent approximation by comparison with the simulation analysis of the independent suspension system with application of analysis software in the kinematics simulation analysis for the loading mechanism.

title: Method analysis and comparison of SVPWM and SPWM
conferenceTitle: Proceedings of the 29th Chinese Control Conference
abstract: SVPWM(space vector PWM) method is introduced, mathematical expressions of inverter output voltage, load phase voltage and load neutral voltage of SVPWM and SPWM are deduced respectively, harmonic wave characteristics of SVPWM is analyzed. Maximum output fundamental voltage and modulation ration of the two methods are calculated, the similarities and differences are analyzed.

title: Notice of Retraction: Rebuilding Shanghai Rural Credit Cooperative Finance by Learning from the Practice of Rural Credit Cooperative in Taiwan District
conferenceTitle: 2010 International Conference on Management and Service Science
abstract: Retracted.

title: Currents through a membrane taking into account the presence of high-frequency components
conferenceTitle: 2010 20th International Crimean Conference "Microwave & Telecommunication Technology"
abstract: Boundary vibration frequencies that influence passive transference of ions through biological membranes taking into account the law of distribution of the concentration on the membrane depth were calculated. By the examples the distribution of high-frequency components of current density on the depth of membrane for different ions, and their influence on the general transference of ions through the membrane of a cell, are shown.

title: Design method for cam contour based on kinematics and dynamics analysis
conferenceTitle: 2010 International Conference on Mechanic Automation and Control Engineering
abstract: Taking a single-cylinder four-stroke engine as the research object, establishing mechanism and dynamic model of dual-mass for valve train, combining engine thermodynamic cycle calculation results, we discussed optimization designing intake cam profile in the two-stroke engine operating mode, through calculation and analysis of kinematics and dynamics.

title: Pricing decisions of a closed-loop supply chain in uncertain environment
conferenceTitle: 2010 Chinese Control and Decision Conference
abstract: A single period two echelon closed-loop supply chain system with retail competing was considered in this paper. Through considering the collecting price, wholesale price and retail prices as triangular fuzzy numbers, the optimal decisions for the manufacturer and the two competing retailers was explored by using fuzzy theory and game theory. The expressions of optimal stackelberg equilibrium decisions for the manufacturer and for the two retailers were established. By using numerical examples, the parameter analysis was given.

title: Notice of Retraction: Research on the comprehensive evaluation of the human resource allocation based on Analytic Hierarchy Process and Fuzzy Mathematics
conferenceTitle: 2010 2nd International Conference on Industrial and Information Systems
abstract: Retracted.

title: Analyzing complexity of enterprise IT capability based on CAS
conferenceTitle: The 2nd International Conference on Information Science and Engineering
abstract: This paper analyzed the complexity of enterprise information technology (IT) capability. By using complex adaptive system (CAS) theory, the author elaborated the CAS characteristics of IT capability. The results show that the enterprise IT capability is a dynamic adaptive capability, and thus has complexity. These results will be helpful to further research of enterprise IT capability.

title: Notice of Retraction: Research on the Construction Modes of New Online Physical Education in Universities
conferenceTitle: 2010 Second International Workshop on Education Technology and Computer Science
abstract: Retracted.

title: General method of digital image restoration
conferenceTitle: 2010 20th International Crimean Conference "Microwave & Telecommunication Technology"
abstract: The pre-processing of digital images within the framework of the general method of digital image restoration based on Wiener technique allowing us to obtain information about additive noise using distorted image is presented.

title: The Mario AI Championship
conferenceTitle: Proceedings of the 2010 IEEE Conference on Computational Intelligence and Games
abstract: The 2010 Mario AI Championship, the successor to the 2009 Mario AI Competition, will run in association with several major international conferences focusing on computational intelligence and games. The competition will consist of three tracks: Gameplay, Learning and Level Generation, with partly overlapping organizers.

title: Notice of Retraction: PSO algorithm-based reliability analysis of bearing capacity of multi-pile composite foundation
conferenceTitle: 2010 Sixth International Conference on Natural Computation
abstract: Retracted.

title: [PDF Not Yet Available In IEEE Xplore]
conferenceTitle: 21st Annual IEEE International Symposium on Personal, Indoor and Mobile Radio Communications
abstract: The document that should appear here is not currently available.

title: Notice of Retraction: Reform and practice of core curriculum teaching in the specialty of building environment and facilities engineering
conferenceTitle: 2010 International Conference on Optics, Photonics and Energy Engineering (OPEE)
abstract: Retracted.

title: Notice of Retraction: The Study of Satisfaction Based on System Test Method
conferenceTitle: 2010 International Conference on Internet Technology and Applications
abstract: Retracted.

title: Modeling and fault diagnosis of hydraulic systems based on Petri nets
conferenceTitle: Proceedings of the 29th Chinese Control Conference
abstract: Petri net is applied to potential fault diagnosis and modeling the dynamic behavior of hydraulic systems. The potential fault in hydraulic systems is described as unobservable transition in Petri nets. Consequently a diagnoser is constructed and an algorithm is presented. The problem of fault diagnosis is transformed into solving linear equation and fault can be diagnosed through the firing of observable transitions. An example of actual hydraulic system is proposed to illustrate the validity and the feasibility of this method.

title: An empirical investigation of product innovation and costomer loyalty in telecommunication industry
conferenceTitle: The 2nd International Conference on Information Science and Engineering
abstract: Based on the review of the relevant researches in the field of product innovation and costomer loyalty, this research analyzed the relationship between product innovation and costomer loyalty, developed a theoretical model, and gave an empirical test. A sample of 282 costomers in telecommunication industry was used to test the model we presented. The result indicates that product innovation has a positive effect on costomer value, costomer satisfaction and costomer loyalty. At the same time, costomer value and costomer satisfaction play important roles in building and sustaining costomer loyalty.

title: Notice of Retraction: The Comprehensive Information Emotion Theory--An Analysis on the Framework
conferenceTitle: 2010 2nd International Conference on Information Engineering and Computer Science
abstract: Retracted.

title: Effects of a tip vane on velocity distribution around wind turbine blade
conferenceTitle: 2010 International Conference on Mechanic Automation and Control Engineering
abstract: It is proved that a tip vane can improve the wind turbine's efficiency by the test and CFD. In this paper, the performance of horizontal axis wind turbine and horizontal axis wind turbine with a tip vane by CFD were simulated. After comparing the velocity distribution around wind turbine blade with the tip vane-V(8.8×8) and without the tip vane and combining the velocity vectors figure of the certain location, the change of the velocity distribution around wind turbine blade and the weakening of the vortex around blade tip with the tip vane can be seen. These can further display the power augmentation theory of the wind turbine by the tip vane.

title: Notice of Retraction: Coal Mine Enterprises Merger & Acquisition Efficiency Prediction Based on Support Vector Machine
conferenceTitle: 2010 Third International Conference on Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining
abstract: Retracted.

title: The real-time technology research of industrial Ethernet in control field
conferenceTitle: 2010 International Conference on Mechanic Automation and Control Engineering
abstract: The Industrial Ethernet for industrial control area has become an inevitable However,the uncertainty and non-real-time are the major obstacle while Ethernet entering the industrial field equipments. The ages,bottlenecks and corresponding solutions of Industrial Ethernet are analysed in this paper. The improvement methods of non-real-time is emphasized,and the prospects of China's EPA real-time Ethernet have also been foreseen.

title: An intelligent temperature control system for nature gas reheating furnace of titanium
conferenceTitle: Proceedings of the 29th Chinese Control Conference
abstract: An intelligent temperature control strategy for different heating segments is proposed based on the characteristic analysis of natural gas reheating furnace of titanium. According to errors between the furnace temperature's measured value and the goal value, a fuzzy controller is used to regulate the nature gas flux. Then the number of the flame burner is determined with expert control method. On the other hand, a method of fuzzy rules is applied to control the atmosphere of reheating furnace according to the change of nature gas flux and measured oxygen content. The temperature control system for natural gas furnace has been established in a titanium enterprise, and the results of real-word application proved the effectiveness of this method.

title: Real-time data acquisition system for pulse laser radar based on clock distribution technology
conferenceTitle: Proceedings of the 29th Chinese Control Conference
abstract: A high-bandwidth data acquisition system for pulse laser radar is developed. Four 250MHz of AD collecting chips are used for data acquisition under clock distribution chip, and then put together for a 1GHz Sps data sample rates. The USB protocol is used for data transmission between system and computer, the AD9520 is used for clock distribution, the FPGA is used for data acquisition, down-conversion, caching and transmission control chip, and the LVPECL and LVDS bus is used to ensure the stability of high-speed data transmission and signal process. The experimental results show that the system can satisfy the data acquisition tasks of the pulse laser radar.

title: A correlational research of regional crude oil pipe networks' spatial dimension and regional crude oil production-consumption in China
conferenceTitle: The 2nd International Conference on Information Science and Engineering
abstract: Based on regional crude oil pipe networks in China, this paper calculates fractal dimensions of weighted length-radius with the help of the software of Arc GIS. Then this paper analyzes the correlation between crude oil pipe networks' fractal features and crude oil production-consumption upon Z-score data normalization and Pearson's correlation coefficient with the help of the software of SPSS. In sum, the amended results revealed: (1) There is an obvious differentiation of the networks between east and west China in terms of density from the fractal dimensions of weighted length-radius. Meanwhile, the density of networks of northeast, north and east China are relatively higher than northwest and south China. (2) It is primary of crude oil consumption to promote the process of crude oil pipe networks' construction and the Pearson's correlation coefficient between networks fractal features and crude oil consumption is 0.878 (high correlation). On the contrary, the correlation between networks fractal features and crude oil production is so low that the Pearson's correlation coefficient between them only reaches 0.076 (non-correlation). (3) For all the regions, there is such a condition of “high networks density, high crude oil consumption” between east China's networks fractal features and her crude oil consumption. However, here is another condition of “low networks density, low crude oil consumption” between northwest and south China's networks fractal features and her crude oil consumption.

title: Trial-and-error procedure of parametres of electromagnetic fields for therapeutic intervention
conferenceTitle: 2010 20th International Crimean Conference "Microwave & Telecommunication Technology"
abstract: The possibilities of existing trial and error methods of electromagnetic fields of various bands for problem solution of therapy are analyzed.

title: Notice of Retraction: Research on the Chinese Intelligence Capital Investment Decision
conferenceTitle: 2010 International Conference on E-Business and E-Government

title: Target Match Recognition Method Based on Contour_Area Feature
conferenceTitle: 2010 International Conference on Electrical and Control Engineering
abstract: Template matching is a method widely used in the area of target detection and tracking. In this paper, a new target match recognition method based on contour area feature is presented. After introduced the idea of this method, the method to construct the matching reference template and compute the matching comparability is explained. The matching performance of this method is analysed according to matching experiments with forward looking infrared real time images. The result shows that this method has applied value to forward looking infrared target recognition.

title: Design of a microstripe bandpass filter with a wide stopband
conferenceTitle: 2010 IEEE MTT-S International Microwave Symposium
abstract: This paper develops a novel microstrip bandpass filter with a wide stopband. With the assistance of open stubs and one open-circuit coupled line using symmetrical feeding, a wide stopband with a sufficient rejection level can be achieved. Detailed design and synthesis procedures are provided. Moreover, the electromagnetic simulator IE3D is used, and the prototype of the bandpass filter is fabricated and measured. Good agreement between measured and simulated results demonstrates feasibility of the proposed filter.

title: Meter character recognition method based on gray template matching
conferenceTitle: Proceedings of the 29th Chinese Control Conference
abstract: Aiming to the problem that spots on meter dial and recurring semi-characters seriously affect character recognition accuracy in the process of automatic meter reading. A template matching algorithm based on gray-scale image is raised for recognizing meter readings. The algorithm firstly locate print wheel region in the print wheel region image on dial after coarse positioning, then match the gray-scale character image with template image one by one. Experiment verify that the algorithm better to overcome the impact of spot caused by meter surface reflection, and both of the whole character and semi-character have a higher recognition rate.

title: Analysis on the application of sketchup software in architectural design teaching
conferenceTitle: The 2nd International Conference on Information Science and Engineering
abstract: In order to help the students of architecture out of the errors of studying architectural design, we should make them truly understand the origin of architectural design and master application skills of Sketchup software. Based on the description of the current lack of architecture education and the feature of Sketchup software, such as keenness in generating program, convenience in modifing the program, flexibility in dealing with environment and so on, we expounded how to organically integrate the software into teaching of architecture to guide the students to focus on the form and space design in the design process. Through thorough understanding of the content of the architectural design, students will enhance their professionalism.
